intro: Lonicera rupicola f. syringantha, commonly known as the rock honeysuckle, is a compact shrub native to the eastern United States. It features small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant once established. Its unique growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and woodland settings.
